subject: Physical Fitness
title: The Rise of the Health Club
description: A quick win: understand The Rise of the Health Club.

hook.text: In the 1970s, gyms were dingy basements for serious lifters. By the 1990s, they had smoothie bars and saunas.

buildup.text: Gold's Gym in Venice Beach became the epicenter of bodybuilding culture, attracting Arnold Schwarzenegger.

discovery.text: The aerobics boom of the 1980s transformed gyms. Mirrors, music, and group classes brought in mainstream members.

twist.text: Corporate gym chains â€” 24 Hour Fitness, Planet Fitness â€” industrialized the model. Gyms became big business.

climax.text: Today, the global fitness industry exceeds $96 billion. What started in basements is now corporate empire.

punchline.text: Gyms went from gritty basements to billion-dollar brands in one generation.

quiz.question: What caused gyms to shift from niche to mainstream in the 1980s?
options: The aerobics boom brought group classes and mainstream appeal
